page.title: 20TAME VALLEY SCHOOL
page.content: This school was opened in 1965. It lies on the fringe of Brinnington housing estate and is situated on the South-West of the river Tame.It overlooks a long stretch of the Tame Valley and far beyond to the Pennine Chain. Maintained by Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council it has % classes of mixed abilities and ages.There are 133 children,70are boys and 63 are girls aged 5 to 11 years.In addition there is a nursery unit where a maximum of 20 children aged 3 to4 attend in the morning and 20 in the afternoon.At present the unit is funded by the Manpower Services Commision.
